ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was the first time I worked on a long-term data science project. I learned how to efficiently scrape and clean data, how to make data visualizations, and how to present my findings in a formal write-up. The most important skill I gained was definitely data visualizations. Brian is the absolute best person in the S&DS department for data visualizations.
This is a senior thesis course for S&DS majors; we generally learn how to apply data science to a specific research topic/project.
I got to research a topic I was interested in during my own time.
research skills in machine learning
Working with my advisors on a semester-long project is one of the best experiences I have had in my major. I am grateful for the guidance and support throughout the semester.
How to do statistics research
How to conduct original research based on all the research Id done in the past, how to modify project scopes according to data availability and time constraints.
The basics of writing a data science report

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought the course was excellent. Compared to the other senior project I completed for my second major, the S&DS senior project was run so much better. From the very beginning, all the pertinent info and deadlines I needed to know were posted on the Canvas page, and the expectations were quite clear. I also always knew where I could go to get help or if I had a question. In contrast, there was so much ambiguity in expectations and deadlines for my senior project in another major. And from talking to my friends in other majors across Yale, I know that S&DS runs one of the very best and most organized senior projects. This is much appreciated!

Strengths:
- Complete flexibility in research topic and timeline (other than final deadline at end of semester).
- Helpful templates given for deliverables (proposal/poster/report).

Weaknesses:
- Little to no structured support/guidance.
They are very flexible with what you want to write about.
Great guidance

The only weakness I could think of is that I would love to learn more about other students' projects and to work together throughout the semester. Otherwise, I had a wonderful experience working with my advisors, and I truly learned a lot beyond the project itself.
I think potentially a little more structure, but I thought overall it was good.
Communication from Brian was great! He was very helpful in providing templates and reminders of due dates.

Strengths: you get to work on your own project for an entire semester, delving as deeply as desired into an interesting application of S&DS
Weaknesses: projects can become quite perfunctory if you (as is not uncommon) wait until the last minute to produce meaningful strides
More oversight over advisor meetings

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. I think all S&DS majors should complete a senior project!

This is not a bad option to complete the S&DS senior requirement. If you want more freedom in topic and form, take this course. If you want more structure or are averse to research, take S&DS 425 Statistical Case Studies.
For the class of 2025 and after, this class will be required. I think everyone should opt-in for the thesis, it's very rewarding!
Yes!
Yes, if you are a serious S&DS major, writing a thesis is a great learning experience.
Yes, it was a great experience.
Definitely do a senior project!! Its such valuable experience to work on a research team and apply your stats knowledge to a tangible topic

Definitely. It offers a prime chance to conduct original research and doesnt require going into a lecture! A great way to end senior year. Also (and this wont be a problem going forward), but 425 is an effortless joke and this is a real senior capstone.
Needed for S&DS

I would highly recommend doing the S&DS thesis. Its very well organized and very rewarding. It was also a great opportunity to get to know a professor closely which I feel like isnt always as easy in our major.
